section.title: Overview
section.abstract: The X-Logic project aims to build generic (i.e. not specific to particular languages or logics) support for deductive inference, with an emphasis on integration with the XML standards.

sbcol.subsec: The directory tree of X-Logic.org giving full access to work in progress.

section.title: Introduction
section.abstract: The ultimate content of X-Logic remains at this stage quite open. Nevertheless we have available a prospectus, some preliminary work on philosophical principles, a crude workplan and a first (pre-design!) alpha release.

sbcol.subsec: The term "philosophy" here covers a broad span. This is a sufficiently important part of the grounding for X-Logic that X-Logic.org hosts the OpenMind formal philosophy site, a major part of which is concerned with foundations for X-Logic. A crucial output from the philosophical analysis is high level formal models which contribute to the architectural design of X-Logic.

A crude workplan for near term work is now available.

The first alpha release concerns the technologies used to build the X-Logic.org website, which includes literate scripts for formal models and listings of the theories created under ProofPower from these scripts, all created from XML sources.

section.title: Philosophy
section.abstract: The OpenMind web site is a testbed for X-Logic technologies and the source of philosophical foundations and high-level formal models for X-Logic.
